headline: WBD Senate hearing: Netflix CEO commits to 45-day theatrical window
summary: Netflix (NFLX) CEO Ted Sarandos is testifying before the Senate Judiciary Subcommittee on Antitrust on Tuesday, addressing the streaming giant's bid to acquire Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD). Sarandos answers Sen. Cory Booker's (D-NJ) questions about industry leaders' fears about the acquisition, the company's plans regarding the moviegoing experience, and more.  To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out Yahoo Finance.

headline: Netflix Promises More Content for Less After Proposed Merger With Warner Bros.
summary: Netflix Inc. and Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. executives defended their media merger against lawmakers' concerns about the proposed tie-up and its impact on streaming consumers and Hollywood workers. "We will give consumers more content for less," Netflix co-Chief Executive Officer Ted Sarandos told Senators on Tuesday.

headline: Paramount Adviser Says of Warner Hostile Bid: ‘We’re Gonna Win’
summary: Blair Effron, co-founder of investment bank Centerview Partners, said at WSJ Invest Live that Paramount will be successful in its hostile pursuit of Warner Bros. Discovery, despite Warner’s existing deal with Netflix.  “We’re gonna win,” Effron, who has been advising Paramount, said.  Paramount launched a $77.9 billion tender offer for Warner shortly after Warner unveiled its $72 billion Netflix deal.

headline: Netflix CEO tells Senate that WBD bid isn't 'typical media merger'
summary: Netflix (NFLX) CEO Ted Sarandos is testifying before the Senate Judiciary Subcommittee on Antitrust on Tuesday, addressing the streaming giant's bid to acquire Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD). In his opening statement, Sarandos outlines Netflix's plans to continue to invest in Warner Bros. studios and content while creating jobs. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out Yahoo Finance.

summary: Netflix co-CEO Ted Sarandos faces Senate questioning over the streaming giant's proposed $72 billion Warner Bros. Discovery merger amid antitrust concerns.

headline: AMD earnings, Netflix-Warner Bros. hearing: What to Watch
summary: Market Domination Overtime Host Josh Lipton previews several of the biggest stories to come tomorrow, Tuesday, February 3, including earnings results from companies like Advanced Micro Devices (AMD), Chipotle Mexican Grill (CMG), Pfizer (PFE), and Merck (MRK), and the Senate hearing on Netflix's (NFLX) proposed bid to acquire Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD). To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime.
